title: Understanding Spontaneity of Reaction
text: To determine whether the reaction is spontaneous, we use the Gibbs free energy equation. What does this equation look like?

title: Understanding the Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: The Gibbs free energy equation is given by ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$. For a reaction to be spontaneous, ΔG must be less than zero. What does this tell you about the relationship between ΔH, T, and ΔS?

title: Setting Up the Inequality
text: We need ΔG < $$0$$ for the reaction to be spontaneous. Substitute ΔH and ΔS into the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$ and solve for T.

title: Verify Units
text: Make sure ΔS is converted to the same units as ΔH before solving for T. What units should ΔS be in?

title: Solving for Temperature (T)
text: Given ΔH $$=$$ $$-641.32$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔS $$=$$ $$-114.720$$ $$\frac{\frac{J}{mol}}{K}$$, calculate the temperature below which the reaction is spontaneous.
